script.text: Terms and conditions, Maximum power: Prescribed output voltage shall be within ± 10% of the rated voltage
Terms and conditions, Maximum power: Prescribed output frequency shall be within ± 8% of the rated frequency
Terms and conditions, Maximum power: The protective device shall not be activated for a period of 5 min
Terms and condtions, Maximum power: The protective device overload conditions shall meet the requirements of section 6.4.
Terms and condtions, Maximum: The minimum ratio between the power rating (COP) and the maximum power (MAX) shall be Prated/Pmax ≥ 0,75

Regulations and additional requirements: For low-power generating sets, depending on the location, regulations referring to environmental and safety requirements defined in the laws and regulations location where generating sets are used shall exist.
General notes on tests: Type tests are made on a single sample and shall withstand all the relevant tests.
General notes on tests: During tests, the ambient air shall be kept between 15 °C and 30 °C
General notes on tests: Generating sets built for more than one type of rated voltage, rated frequency or current shall be tested for all relevant operating parameters.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), General: Acceptability of the component parts of the generating set shall be judged on the mechanical and electrical strength and resistance to ignition and distortion.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Generator, Rating and performance: The generator shall meet the requirements of IEC 60034-1 concerning duty type S1, covering rated values, irregularities of waveform, symmetry of voltages, capability of unbalanced load, temperature rise, dielectric properties and short circuit strength.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Generator, Rating and performance: Compliance shall be checked by checking manufacturers documentation.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Generator, Connection to stator or field: Access to brushes shall not be possible without tools.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Generator, Connection to stator or field: Screw caps or brush holders shall be screwed against a shoulder or a similar stop and grip with at least three full threads.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Connection to stator or field: Brush holders in which the brush is held in position by a locking facility shall be made in such a way as to ensure that locking is not dependent on brush spring pressure if loosening of the locking facility could give access to live parts.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Connection to stator or field: Screw caps of brush holders accessible from the outside surface of the generator shall be made of insulating material or be covered by insulating material of suitable mechanical and electrical strength.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Connection to stator or field: Screw caps of brush holders accessible from the outside surface of the generator shall not project beyond the surrounding surface of the unit.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Connection to stator or field: Compliance shall be checked by visual inspection, mechanical test according to ISO 8528-13:2016, 6.12 and dielectric strength according to IEC 60335-1:2013, 13.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Connection of electric loads: Except for extra low voltages (≤ 50 V), low voltages plug-and-socket connections according to IEC/TR 60083 (single phase) and IEC 60309 (multiphase), or relevant national standards, shall be applied.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Connection of electric loads: It shall not be possible to confuse plugs and socket outlets for very low voltage circuits with those plugs and socket outlets for low voltage circuits. (Very low voltage ≤ 50 V and 50 < Low voltage ≤ 1 000 V.)
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Screws and connections: Screws and connections shall be designed in accordance with IEC 60335-1:2010, Clause 28.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Electrical equipment, Screws and connections: Compliance shall be checked in accordance with IEC 60335-1:2013, Clause 28.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Temperature rise, General: During the operating of a generating set with given ratings, the permitted temperature limits shall not be exceeded, meaning if at average permitted power and for a minimum run of 60 min, the permitted values according to sections 6.3.2 and 6.3.3 are not exceeded.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Temperature rise, Generator: The permitted temperature limits for a generator are given in IEC 60034-1:2010, Clause 8.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Temperature rise, Generator: Compliance shall be checked by the generator being operated at ambient conditions as defined in Clause 5.
Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Temperature rise, Generator: Temperature rise test and method of measurement shall be in accordance with IEC 60034-1:2010, Clause 8.

Mechanical and electrical design (requirements and tests), Temperature rise, Generator: During the rise test the average permitted power for the generating set shall be maintained at a constant level.
